abstract: Christopher Clarey On Tennis column observes Serena Williams, fresh from winning her sixth Wimbledon women's title, now heads toward potential Grand Slam victory at the United States Open; asserts that time has come to seriously consider whether she is greatest player of all time; argues that Williams's greatness sometimes goes unheralded precisely because she has been so consistent, and her victories lack surprise value.
lead_paragraph: If “greatest” means the player who would have beaten all the rest at their respective peaks, it is hard not to feel a strong tug in Williams’s direction.

headline.main: It’s Time to Appreciate Serena Williams’s Greatness
headline.print_headline: One Win From a Slam and, Perhaps, Status as the Greatest

snippet: If “greatest” means the player who would have beaten all the rest at their respective peaks, it is hard not to feel a strong tug in Williams’s direction.
